info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL NORTHUMBERLAND... SOUTHEASTERN MONTOUR...COLUMBIA AND SOUTHEASTERN SULLIVAN COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bloomsburg, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bloomsburg, Fernville and Mainville around 350 PM EDT. Lightstreet, Almedia and Mifflinville around 355 PM EDT. Berwick around 400 PM EDT. Rohrsburg around 405 PM EDT. Waller around 410 PM EDT. Central and Jamison City around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Briar Creek, Lime Ridge, Orangeville, Espy and Benton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
